com.snap2d.world

Class CollisionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.world.CollisionModel

  • public class CollisionModel
extends Object
    Allows for precise, efficient collision detection between two entities with polygon bounding. The Snap2D SpriteEditor can be used to create and save polygon bounds for images.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CollisionModel(Point[] pts, int wt, int ht, World2D world)
      Note: width/height of the polygon is defined by the greatest dist between its points along the X/Y axes, or in other words, the dimensions of its rectangular bounds.
      CollisionModel(SpriteData spriteData, World2D world)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollisionModel

        public CollisionModel(Point[] pts,
              int wt,
              int ht,
              World2D world)
        Note: width/height of the polygon is defined by the greatest dist between its points along the X/Y axes, or in other words, the dimensions of its rectangular bounds.
        Parameters:
        pts - the points of the polygon bounds (in order)
        wt - width of the polygon
        ht - height of the polygon
        world - the world in which the entity represented by this model resides

      • CollisionModel

        public CollisionModel(SpriteData spriteData,
              World2D world)

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(PointUD p,
               PointUD modelLoc)
        Tests to see if the given point lies within this CollisionModel
        Parameters:
        p - the point to test
        modelLoc - the location of this CollisionModel in world space; the given point will be translated to the origin with respect to this point. If null, no translation is applied.
        Returns:
        true if this CollisionModel's polygon bounds contain the given PointUD, false otherwise

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(double x,
                   double y,
                   double cx,
                   double cy,
                   CollisionModel coll)

      • resolve

        public void resolve(PointUD loc,
           PointUD cloc,
           CollisionModel coll,
           Vector2d vel,
           Vector2d cvel,
           double velFactor,
           double resolutionThreshold)
        Resolves the assumed collision between this CollisionModel and 'coll' by testing and modifying the given PointUD locations.
        Parameters:
        loc - the position of this CollisionModel in world space
        cloc - the position of the other CollisionModel in world space
        coll - the other (colliding) CollisionModel
        vel - the velocity of this CollisionModel as a Vector2d
        cvel - the velocity of this CollisionModel as a Vector2d
        velFactor - the multiplier to use when applying the vectors to the points - this could be a time ratio or just 1 for basic vector/point relationships
        resolutionThreshold - the maximum magnitude of distance that must be between the two models for the collision to be considered resolved - for most 2D coordinate systems, 1 is a good value to use, although it could be lower if 1 world unit < 1 screen unit or simply if more accuracy is desired relative to +-1 pixel.

      • createCircleBounds

        public static Point[] createCircleBounds(int size,
                         double angleIncrem)
        Creates an approximation of a circular bounding area represented by a polygon. The smaller the angle increment, the more accurate the polygon will be. The larger the increment, the better performance/memory-use will be.
        Parameters:
        size - diameter of the circle in pixels.
        angleIncrem - the angle (in radians) between each computed point on the circle for drawing lines
        Returns:
        an array of ordered polygon points in screen space
